intro: Arabidopsis mollis, commonly known as the soft Arabidopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a small annual plant that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft appearance. It produces small white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, which are characteristic of the Brassica family. Arabidopsis mollis is native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats.
